titles.ar: باب مَنْ يَشْتَرِي الْحَيَوَانَ وَ لَهُ لَبَنٌ يَشْرَبُهُ ثُمَّ يَرُدُّهُ
titles.en: Chapter 71 – The one who buys the animal and for it is milk; he drinks it then returns it

titles.ar: باب إِذَا اخْتَلَفَ الْبَائِعُ وَ الْمُشْتَرِي
titles.en: Chapter 72 – When the seller and the buyer differ

titles.ar: باب الشَّرْطِ وَ الْخِيَارِ فِي الْبَيْعِ
titles.en: Chapter 70 – The stipulation (of returning goods) and the choice regarding (not transacting) the sale

titles.ar: باب مَنْ يَشْتَرِي الْحَيَوَانَ وَ لَهُ لَبَنٌ يَشْرَبُهُ ثُمَّ يَرُدُّهُ
titles.en: Chapter 71 – The one who buys the animal and for it is milk; he drinks it then returns it

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل وسنده الثاني حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (19/169)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي الْمَغْرَاءِ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي

text: رَجُلٍ اشْتَرَى شَاةً فَأَمْسَكَهَا ثَلَاثَةَ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ رَدَّهَا قَالَ إِنْ كَانَ فِي تِلْكَ الثَّلَاثَةِ الْأَيَّامِ يَشْرَبُ لَبَنَهَا رَدَّ مَعَهَا ثَلَاثَةَ أَمْدَادٍ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهَا لَبَنٌ فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ شَيْ‏ءٌ

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, fromthe one who mentioned it, from Abu Al Magra, from Al Halby,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> regarding a man who bought a sheep, so he kept it for three days, then returned it. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If it was such that during those three days he had drunk its milk, so he should return it along with three handfuls (of grain etc.); and if there did not happen to have any milk for it, so there is nothing upon him’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from those whom he has mentioned from abu al-Mighra’ from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “This is about the case of a man who had purchased a sheep and had kept it for three days; then returned it, abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘If during those three days he had consumed its milk he returns it with three handful of food. If the sheep did not have any milk he then does not owe anything.”’ Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy from abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, a similar Hadith.

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مِثْلَهُ

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby, from Abu Abdullahasws – similar to it’.
